meanings.definition: To lower in rank or reputation.
meanings.sent1: She was disrating her own skills by constantly comparing herself to others.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to disrate the student's behavior due to repeated disruptions in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat disrated itself in the eyes of the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to disrate the beauty of the sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments online can disrate a business quickly if left unaddressed.

meanings.definition: To give a lower rating or evaluation to.
meanings.sent1: He didn't want to disrate the restaurant, but the service was very slow.
meanings.sent2: The judge had to disrate the performance due to several mistakes made by the contestant.
meanings.sent3: The movie critic couldn't help but disrate the film after noticing numerous plot holes.
meanings.sent4: The storm's arrival seemed to disrate the chances of having a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: It's important not to disrate someone's efforts without understanding the challenges they faced.
